courses.name: Introduction to Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Orientation course for freshmen-level students. Introduction to careers and opportunities in chemical engineering, basic engineering principles, simple calculations.

courses.name: Introduction to Chemical Engineering - Honors
courses.description: Orientation course for freshmen-level students. Introduction to careers and opportunities in chemical engineering, basic engineering principles, simple calculations.
courses.hours: 2Prerequisites or Corequisites: MATH 1500, CHEM 1320.  Honors eligibility required

courses.name: Chemistry and Chemical Technology I
courses.description: Covers fundamental principals of chemistry, gases, engineering materials, electrochemistry, and applications with instruction including numerical modeling.  Graded on A/F basis only. May be repeated for credit.

courses.name: Chemistry and Chemical Technology II
courses.description: Covers fundamentals principals of chemistry, gases, engineering materials, electrochemistry, and applications with instruction including numerical modeling.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A/F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: CH_ENG 1320 or CHEM 1320 and MATH 1500Corequisites: MATH 1500

courses.name: Advanced Experimental Course
courses.description: Content and number of credit hours to be listed in Schedule of Courses.

courses.name: Introduction to Energy Technology and Sustainability
courses.description: An introductory course on energy technology and those resources and practices that allow for sustainable commercialization. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Mass and Energy Balance
courses.description: Industrial stoichiometry, material and energy balances, thermophysics, thermochemistry; related topics.

courses.name: Engineering Process Computations and Laboratory
courses.description: Introduction to the effective use of computer software with emphasis on chemical engineering applications, which include solutions for systems of algebraic equations using matrix methods;   solutions of ordinary differential equations and partial differential equations and visualization of those solutions; linear, multilinear, and nonlinear regression for data analysis; 2D and 3D plotting, symbolic calculations, process control simulations, and text processing.

courses.name: Principles of Chemical Engineering I
courses.description: Fluid flow, heat and mass transfer. A comprehensive treatment of the transport processes related to chemical engineering operations, with focus on both theory and applications.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CH_ENG 2225

courses.name: Principles of Chemical Engineering II
courses.description: Separation processes in chemical engineering, including: Evaporation, absorption, distillation, extraction, leaching, membrane separation, and drying.

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Laboratory I
courses.description: Laboratory study of some principal unit operations of chemical engineering.

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Laboratory I - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Laboratory study of some principal unit operations of chemical engineering.

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics I
courses.description: Study of thermodynamics, with particular reference to chemical engineering applications.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C or better in CH_ENG 2225

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics II
courses.description: Chemical thermodynamics, with emphasis on mixtures. Multicomponent systems and phase diagrams; excess properties; chemical potential, fugacity, and activity; models of non-ideal mixtures; phase and surface equilibria; chemical reaction equilibria.

courses.name: Chemical Process Safety and Professional Ethics
courses.description: A course focused on important technical fundamentals of chemical process safety and their application including professional ethics considerations. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Topics in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in chemical engineering.

courses.name: Problems in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Directed study of chemical engineering problems.

courses.name: Hazardous Waste Management
courses.description: (same as CV_ENG 4220; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7220, CV_ENG 7220). Engineering principles involved in handling, collection, transportation, processing and disposal of hazardous waste, waste minimization, legislation on hazardous wastes and groundwater contamination.

courses.name: Engineering Research Calculations and Reporting
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7226). Application and analysis of engineering calculations in MS Excel, Matlab, and project-specific software including applications of calculus, experiential learning, and supervised research. Must have research advisor define at least one experiment and review at least one report.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Design of Experiments and Statistical Quality Control for Process Engineers
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 4270; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7270, BIOL_EN 7270).  A practical statistical tool box for experimenters:  process means, effects of variables, factorial experiments, and statistical quality control.
courses.recommendation: experience with Excel or instructor's consent

courses.name: Pollution Prevention
courses.description: Identify, analyze, and solve energy, water, and raw materials inefficiencies common to industrial processes and facilities. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: CHEM 1320, ENGINR 2300 or CH_ENG 3261, MATH 2300, and PHYSCS 2760

courses.name: Advanced Engineering Math
courses.description: (same as NU_ENG 4306). Applies ordinary and partial differential equations to engineering problems; Fourier's series; determinants and matrices; Laplace transforms; analog computer techniques.

courses.name: Chemodynamics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7311). Environmental movement of chemicals in air, water, and soil; designed to introduce students to the basic principles and techniques useful for the prediction of the movement and fate chemicals in ecosystems.

courses.name: Air Pollution Control
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7312). Modeling of urban air pollution and control techniques. Topics treated are plume dispersion theories, photochemistry, methods of monitoring, methods of industrial abatement and legal aspects.

courses.name: Introduction to Bioprocess Engineering
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 4315; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7315, BIOL_EN 7315).  This general introduction to bioprocess engineering covers the fundamentals of microbiology and biochemistry in the context of a biomass refinery.  Analyses proceed through the use of mass balances, energy balances, and empirical or theoretical models.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 (for Biological Engineering students) or CH_ENG 2225 (for Chemical Engineering students) or instructor's consent

courses.name: Biomass Refinery Operations
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 4316; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7316, BIOL_EN 4316).  Design and operation of processes for conversion and/or fractionation of biomass and associated upstream and downstream unit operations.  Emphasis on separations and product recovery.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 (for Biological Engineering students) or CH_ENG 2225 (for Chemical Engineering students) or  instructor's consent

courses.name: Chemical Processing in Semiconductor Device
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7317). This course covers the current plasma processing methods used to produce semiconductor devices with emphasis on memory devices. The physics and chemistry of how plasmas are formed, sustained and interact with the semiconductor wafers being processed. Plasma chemistry and the chemical reactions used in plasma etching are discussed.

courses.name: Energy Technology and Sustainability
courses.description: An introductory course on energy technology, resources, practices, and common calculations used for energy analysis. May be repeated for credit.
courses.recommendation: at least one engineering thermodynamics course or a Physical Chemistry course or instructor's consent

courses.name: Introduction to Polymer Materials
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7319). An introduction to the structure and properties of polymers. Solution properties, molecular weight determination and rheological behavior are studied. Manufacturing and processing techniques are considered.

courses.name: Introduction to Ceramics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7321). Introductory course in ceramics materials, crystal structure, processes and properties.  The course content and level of presentation would allow an entry level engineering to be conversant with the terminology and concepts of ceramic science and engineering.

courses.name: Transport Phenomena
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7335). Integrated study of momentum, heat and mass transport.

courses.name: Special Reading in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Individually supervised special reading leading to an engineering report.

courses.name: Chemical Reaction Engineering and Technology
courses.description: Reactor design and optimization; rate equations; thermal effects in reactor.

courses.name: Process Control Methods and Laboratory
courses.description: State-space modeling, simulation, and experimental validation; stability analysis; feedback design and experimental studies; methods for disturbance rejection.

courses.name: Chemical Engineering Design I
courses.description: The course presents optimum design methods, cost estimation, material selection and other relevant areas for the design of chemical plants. In addition, chemical safety and risk assessment will be covered.

courses.name: Electrochemical Reaction Engineering Science
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7464). Phenomenological behavior of electrochemical processes (battery emphasis).  Theoretical interpretations of diffusion and reaction processes including system modeling.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: CH_ENG 3261 or MAE 2300 or CHEM 3310 or instructor's consent
courses.recommendation: A course in thermodynamics or physical chemistry

courses.name: Process Synthesis and Design
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7980). Continuation of CH_ENG 4385: application of chemical analysis and modeling to a capstone design project.

courses.name: Process Synthesis and Design - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7980). Continuation of CH_ENG 4385: application of chemical analysis and modeling to a capstone design project.

courses.name: Undergraduate Research in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Directed study of chemical engineering problems.

courses.name: Undergraduate Research in Chemical Engineering - Honors
courses.description: Individual research for a senior thesis; research is supervised by the chemical engineering faculty. The thesis is to be defended before the departmental Honors committee.

courses.name: Topics in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Current and new technical developments in chemical engineering.

courses.name: Hazardous Waste Management
courses.description: (same as CV_ENG 7220; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4220, CV_ENG 4220). Engineering principles involved in handling, collection transportation, processing and disposal of hazardous waste minimization, legislation on hazardous wastes and groundwater contamination.

courses.name: Engineering Research Calculations and Reporting
courses.description: (cross_leveled with CH_ENG 4226). Application and analysis of engineering calculations in MS Excel, Matlab, and project-specific software including applications of calculus, experiential learning, and supervised research. Must have research advisor define at least one experiment and review at least one report. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Design of Experiments and Statistical Quality Control for Process Engineers
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7270; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4270, BIOL_EN 4270).  A practical statistical tool box for experimenters:  process means, effects of variables, factorial experiments, and statistical quality control.
courses.prerequisites: experience with Excel or instructor's consent

courses.name: Chemodynamics
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4311). Environmental movement of chemicals in air, water, and soil; designed to introduce students to the basic principles and techniques useful for the prediction of the movement and fate chemicals in ecosystems.

courses.name: Air Pollution Control
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4312). Modeling of urban air pollution and control techniques. Topics treated are plume dispersion theories, photochemistry, methods of monitoring, methods of industrial abatement and legal aspects.

courses.name: Introduction to Bioprocess Engineering
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7315; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4315, BIOL_EN 4315). This General introduction to bioprocess engineering covers the fundamentals of microbiology and biochemistry in the context of a biomass refinery.  Analysis proceed through the use of mass balances, energy balances, and empirical or theoretical models.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 (for biological engineering students) or CH_ENG 2225 (for chemical engineering students) or instructor's consent

courses.name: Biomass Refinery Operation
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7316; cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4316, BIOL_EN 4316).  Design and operation of processes for conversion and/or fractionation of biomass and associated upstream and downstream unit operations.  Emphasis on separations and product recovery.
courses.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 or CH_ENG 2225 or instructor's consent

courses.name: Chemical Processing in Semiconductor Device
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4317). This course covers the current plasma processing methods used to produce semiconductor devices with emphasis on memory devices. The physics and chemistry of how plasmas are formed, sustained and interact with the semiconductor wafers being processed. Plasma chemistry and the chemical reactions used in plasma etching are discussed.

courses.name: Introduction to Polymer Materials
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 7319). An introduction to the structure and properties of polymers. Solution properties, molecular weight determination and rheological behavior are studied. Manufacturing and processing techniques are considered.

courses.name: Introduction to Ceramic Material
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4321). Introductory course in ceramics materials, crystal structure, processes and properties.  The course content and level of presentation would allow an entry-level engineer to be conversant with the terminology and concepts of ceramics science and engineering.

courses.name: Transport Phenomena
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4335). Integrated study of momentum, heat and mass transport.

courses.name: Electrochemical Reaction Engineering Science
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4464). Phenomenological behavior of electrochemical processes (battery emphasis).  Theoretical interpretations of diffusion and reaction processes including system modeling.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: CH_ENG 3261 or MAE 2300 or CHEM 3310 or instructor's consent
courses.recommendation: A course in thermodynamics or physical chemistry

courses.name: Synthesis and Design of Chemical Process
courses.description: (cross-leveled with CH_ENG 4980). This is a heuristics-based design course intended to assist students in bringing together capabilities from previous course.  An emphasis is placed on the creation process of design.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Plasma Processing
courses.description: Concepts and techniques in novel plasma processing: plasma characteristics, plasma sputtering, plasma enhanced chemical vapor deposition (PECVD), plasma etching, plasma treatment, plasma fabrication of nano-structured materials and diamondlike films, biomedical applications.

courses.name: Problems in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Supervised investigation in chemical engineering to be presented in the form of a report.

courses.name: Seminar in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Reviews investigations and projects of importance in chemical engineering.

courses.name: Advanced Ceramic Materials
courses.description: (same as BIOL_EN 8230 and MAE 8230). To provide an advanced level understanding between processing, properties, and microstructure of ceramic materials.  Topics include crystallography, defect chemistry, transport properties, microstructure, and forming methods.  Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Plasma Polymerization
courses.description: Fundamental aspects of polymer formation in plasma state: gas ionization, reaction kinetics, plasma characteristics and operational parameters of plasma reactors. Properties of plasma - synthesized ultrathin films and their utilization also discussed.

courses.name: Advanced Heat and Momentum Transfer
courses.description: Advanced study of these transport phenomena.

courses.name: Advanced Mass Transfer
courses.description: Advanced study of mass transfer.

courses.name: Analysis of Equilibrium Stage Processes
courses.description: Advanced study of stage processes.

courses.name: Membranes and Membrane Processes
courses.description: Thermodynamics and mass transfer of membrane separation processes; Concentration-Driven Processes; Pressure-Driven Processes; Electromembrane Processes; Biological Membrane Processes; Membrane Polymers; Preparation of Membranes; Membrane Separation Application (potable and ultrapure water, effluent treatment, gas separations, electrochemistry, dialysis therapeutic, and other applications).

courses.name: Advanced Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics I
courses.description: Advanced thermodynamics; particular reference to its application to chemical engineering.

courses.name: Advanced Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics II
courses.description: Introduction to the methods of statistical thermodynamics and statistical mechanics.  The method of ensembles, Maxwell-Boltzmann statistics, the kinetic theory of gases, and theories of liquids.  Applications of statistical mechanics to the prediction of physical and chemical properties such as rate coefficients, diffusion coefficients, and conductivities.  Graded A-F only.

courses.name: Chemical Reaction Engineering Science
courses.description: Phenomenological behavior of catalysts. Theoretical interpretations for heterogeneous and homogeneous catalysts.

courses.name: Process Optimization Methods in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Steady-state and unsteady-state optimization techniques applied to chemical processes.

courses.name: Research-Masters Thesis in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Independent investigation in chemical engineering, to be presented as a thesis. Graded on a S/U basis only.

courses.name: Research-Doctoral Dissertation in Chemical Engineering
courses.description: Independent investigation in chemical engineering, to be presented as a thesis. Graded on a S/U basis only.  candidate
